reviews.title: Parent Reviews
reviews.subtitle: What families say about Little Seedlings

items.text: After just four months at Little Seedlings, my 5-year-old could already speak English fluently in almost every context. Beyond English, we saw our stepson grow out of his toddler habits and embrace boyhood with many new virtues. The teachers handled his hyperactivity with such love and care. We never felt guilty about his behavior, only more dedicated to helping him improve. There are no words to express our gratitude.
items.author: Chad Meyers

items.text: My daughter attended Little Seedlings for about three weeks in the summer as a summer school and it was wonderful! She made many friends, the teachers were very helpful and kind — also helping her with reading and prepping for school. The children get meals and a lot of outside playtime, which is wonderful.
items.author: Anne Nemsitsveridze-Daniels

items.text: Our 5-year-old son attended Little Seedlings from its opening. We can say this kindergarten is the one thing we miss the most. The owners, Mari and Willem, created the atmosphere of a warm, welcoming home rather than a formal educational establishment. Our kid was truly happy there. He showed huge progress in English, math and reading. The Montessori method of learning through play worked perfectly for him.
items.author: Kirill Bashtovoy

items.text: Our twin 5-year-olds love, love Little Seedlings. We love the size of the school, how international it is, and are amazed at what they have learned there. They come home singing songs about the planets and the continents and have made great friends. Mari, the director, is wonderful and provides excellent feedback along the way to make sure everyone's needs are met.
items.author: Amy Beaulieu

items.text: It is the best kindergarten. We highly recommend it.
items.author: Dmitrii Kaplan

items.text: It is such a loving kindergarten with wonderful teachers. My 4.5-year-old daughter loved going there every morning. Very, very recommended.
items.author: Yael Gabay
